channel.title: Object positioning problem

item.title: Object positioning problem
item.dc:creator: @walkineagle walkineagle
item.description:
@walkineagle wrote:

How do you get the ID of an object at a position? Like: getObject(x,y)
I really really really need that…

I solved the first part.

Read full topic

item.title: Object positioning problem
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

What do mean off key? Is the stump appearing as if it’s one square over or something? If it is, just edit your AddGlobalObject line to add +1 X or Y coordinate. You could also try changing the rotation.

I’m not sure if it’s the problem but with some objects I’ve noticed the middle of them doesn’t start where your character stands.

Read full topic

item.title: Object positioning problem
item.dc:creator: @walkineagle walkineagle
item.description:
@walkineagle wrote:

I’m just doing a very simple test to see if I can do something, but I can’t get this position proper.

case 1278: if(playerHasItem(1267) == true || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1267){ DeleteObject(objectX, objectY); AddGlobalObject(objectX, objectY, 9661, 0, 10);// } break;

That checks if the player has an iron pickaxe and clicks a tree, deletes the tree and is supposed to place a tree stump directly over it, my problem is that the tree stump is off key, is there any way to fix this?

Read full topic
